sen.j: 丹波橋駅（たんばばしえき）は、京都府京都市伏見区桃山筒井伊賀西町にある、京阪電気鉄道京阪本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Momoyama Tsutsui Iga Nishi-Machi Fushimi Ward Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Tanbabashi Station is a stop on the Keihan Main Line of the Keihan Electric Railway.
Tanbabashi Station, located in Momoyama Tsutsui Iga Nishi-Machi Fushimi Ward Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Keihan Main Line of the Keihan Electric Railway.
Tanbabashi Station, located in Momoyama Tsutsui Iga Nishi-machi, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Keihan Main Line of the Keihan Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: カンマを追加しました。

sen.j: 本稿では奈良電気鉄道（並びに近畿日本鉄道）との共用時代に付いても記す。
sen.e: This article mentions about the period that this station was shared by Nara Electric Railway (and Kintetsu Railways).
This article describes the period during which this station was shared by Nara Electric Railway (and Kintetsu Railways).
This section describes the period during which this station was shared by Nara Electric Railway (and Kintetsu Railways).

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 島式2面4線のプラットホームを持つ待避可能駅。
sen.e: This station has two island type platforms and four tracks (one platform serving two tracks), equipped with safety measures.
This station has two island-type platforms and four tracks (one platform serving two tracks), and is equipped with safety measures.
This station has two island-type platforms and four tracks (one platform serving two tracks), and is equipped with passing facilities.
sen.cmt: This is closer is meaning to the Japanese, I think.

sen.j: 北口は地下駅舎となっている。
sen.e: The north exit is used as the underground station-house.
The north exit is used as the underground station house.
The north exit is used as the underground station house.

sen.j: 南口は橋上駅となっており、全てのホームにエスカレーター・エレベーター、出口にはエレベーターが設置されている。
sen.e: The south exit is used as an elevated station-house and the escalators and the elevators are set up between platforms and the elevated station-house. There is an elevator in the south exit.

The south exit is used as an elevated station house, and the escalators and elevators are provided between the platforms and the elevated station house; additionally, there is an elevator at the south exit.

The south exit is used as an elevated station house, and the escalators and elevators are provided between the platforms and the elevated station house; additionally, there is an elevator at the south exit.

sen.j: 近鉄京都線の近鉄丹波橋駅とは南口から連絡通路で結ばれており、乗り換え可能である。
sen.e: This station is connected to the Kintetsu-Tanbabashi Station by the walk-through from the south exit, and it is used for transfer.
This station is connected to Kintetsu-Tanbabashi Station by a walk-through from the south exit, and it is used for transfers.
This station is connected to Kintetsu-Tanbabashi Station of the Kintetsu Kyoto Line by a walk-through from the south exit, and it is used for transfers.
sen.cmt: Kintetsu Kyoto Line 追加しました。

sen.j: 北口は以前は地上駅舎で、ホームとは構内踏切で結ばれていた。
sen.e: The station-house of the north exit used to be on the ground and the station-house and the platforms were connected by the railroad crossing in the station yard.
The station house of the north exit used to be at ground level, and the station house and platforms were connected by the railroad crossing in the station yard.
The station house of the north exit used to be at ground level, and the station house and platforms were connected by the railroad crossing in the station yard.

sen.j: のりば
sen.e: Platforms
Platforms
Platforms

sen.j: 待避線への分岐がきつく、優等列車に連絡する列車が大きな音できしみながら発車する様子が見て取れる。
sen.e: The branching curve to the refuge track is sharp and cars coupled to the Express trains start with big squeak noise.
The branching curve to the refuge track is sharp, and cars coupled to the express trains start with a loud squeaking noise.
The branching curve to the refuge track is sharp, and trains which wait for higher priority trains in the refuge track start with a loud squeaking noise.
sen.cmt: 「連絡する」というのは、優等列車を待避線で待つ、という意味と解釈しました。I have been unable to confirm whether the above is the correct interpretation of "連絡". The English itself is basically fine, but I think "higher priority" is more natural than "higher category".

sen.j: 昼間時間帯には特急と普通（時間帯によっては準急）が土休日の午前中、夕方以降は特急or急行と普通が、平日の夕方以降は下り大阪方面行きはK特急と急行が、上り出町柳方面行きはK特急・急行と普通が、それぞれ緩急・急急結合の接続を行う。
sen.e: Cars are coupled in several ways depends on the time and days as follows; daytime: Limited Express and Local (sometimes, Semi-express), morning and evening on weekends and holidays: Limited Express/Express and Local, after evening on weekdays: K-Limited Express and Express bound for Osaka, K-Limited Express, Express and Local bound for Demachiyanagi.

Cars are coupled in several ways depending on the time and day, as follows: daytime: limited express and local (occasionally semi-express); morning and evening on weekends and holidays: limited express/express and local; after weekday evenings: K-limited express and express bound for Osaka, K-limited express, express and local bound for Demachiyanagi.

Higher and lower priority trains are coupled together depending on the time and day, as follows: during the day, limited expresses and local trains (occasionally semi-expresses) are coupled together; in the morning and evening on weekends and holidays, limited expresses/expresses and local trains are coupled together; in the late evening and at night on weekdays, K-limited expresses and expresses bound for Osaka are coupled together, while K-limited expresses/expresses and local trains bound for Demachiyanagi are coupled together.
sen.cmt: 「緩急・急急結合の接続」の箇所などをこのように解釈し訳しました。I have had to rewrite this quite a but to avoid having back-to-back colons. Also, "after weekday evenings" seems very unclear to me. I have assumed "夕方以降" means "late evening and night".

sen.j: 発車メロディが導入されている。
sen.e: Departure melody is introduced.
A departure melody has been introduced.
A departure melody has been introduced.

sen.j: 自動改札機は、東芝製が設置されている。
sen.e: The automatic ticket gates manufactured by Toshiba are set up.
The automatic ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.
The automatic ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.

sen.j: 全てPiTaPa・ICOCA対応。
sen.e: PiTaPa/ICOCA cards are accepted.
PiTaPa/ICOCA cards are accepted.
PiTaPa/ICOCA cards are accepted.

Momoyama Elementary School Attached to the Kyoto University of Education

sen.j: バスのりば
sen.e: Bus stop
Bus stop
Bus stop

sen.j: 京阪丹波橋駅には、バス路線は乗り入れていない。
sen.e: There is no bus route which stops at the Keihan-Tanbabashi Station.
No bus route stops at Keihan-Tanbabashi Station.
No bus route stops at Keihan-Tanbabashi Station.

sen.j: 最寄バス停：京都市交通局丹波橋
sen.e: Nearest bus stop : Tanbabashi Station of Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau
Nearest bus stop: Tanbabashi Station of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau
Nearest bus stop: Tanbabashi Station of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau

sen.j: 丹波橋
sen.e: Tanbabashi
Tanbabashi
Tanbabashi

sen.j: バス停は駅前ではなく、駅から徒歩5分の国道24号沿いにある。
sen.e: Located along the Route 24, the bus stop is a 5-minute walk away from the railroad station.
The bus stop, located along Route 24, is a five-minute walk from the railroad station.
The bus stop, located along National Route 24, is a five-minute walk from the railroad station.

sen.j: 京都市バス
sen.e: Kyoto City Bus
Kyoto City Bus
Kyoto City Bus

sen.j: 南8系統：（藤森神社経由）竹田駅 (京都府)東口行／横大路車庫行
sen.e: South 8 Route : bound for Takeda Sta. East Exit (Higashiguchi) (via Fujimori Jinja-mae) / Yokooji Shako-mae
South 8 Route: bound for Takeda Sta. East Exit (Higashiguchi) (via Fujimori Jinja-mae) / Yokooji Shako-mae
South 8 Route: bound for Takeda Station (Kyoto Prefecture) East Exit (Higashiguchi) (via Fujimori-jinja Shrine) / Yokooji-shako Depot
sen.cmt: 京都府 を追加しました。

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: かつては、2線を近鉄京都線が使用し、相互直通運転を行っていた。
sen.e: Kintetsu Kyoto Line used to use both Kintetsu and Keihan lines and go through mutually.
The Kintetsu Kyoto Line once used both the Kintetsu and Keihan lines, and they would go through mutually.
The Kintetsu Kyoto Line once used both the Kintetsu and Keihan lines, and they would go through mutually.

sen.j: 近鉄京都線の架線電圧1500V昇圧（1969年実施）・京阪本線ATS設置（1967年より順次実施）を控え、駅構内の平面交差が列車増発の差し支えになることから、1968年に相互直通運転を廃止。
sen.e: However, before raising the line voltage up to 1500V (complied with in 1969) and the settlement of ATS (automatic train stop system) on the Keihan Main Line (complying with from 1967 sequentially), the mutual operation was ceased in 1968 because crossing at grade in the station yard would bring detriment to increase of the number of trains.

However, before raising the line voltage to 1500V (upon compliance in 1969) and the settlement of ATS (Automatic Train Stop system) on the Keihan Main Line (with compliance from 1967 sequentially), the mutual operation was ceased in 1968 because the crossing at grade in the station yard would hinder an increase in the number of trains.

However, before raising the line voltage to 1500V (upon compliance in 1969) and the settlement of ATS (Automatic Train Stop system) on the Keihan Main Line (with compliance from 1967 sequentially), the mutual operation was ceased in 1968 because the crossing at grade in the station yard would hinder an increase in the number of trains.

sen.j: それに合わせて近鉄京都線の駅は近鉄丹波橋駅として独立し、近鉄線との連絡線は撤去されている（駅北側の駐輪場周辺や、駅南側の分岐線跡地にその名残が見られる）。
sen.e: Therefore, the station of the Kintetsu Kyoto Line became independent as Kintetsu-Tanbabashi Station and the connecting line to Kintetsu Line was removed. (The trace of mutual operation can be seen at the bicycle parking area in the north side of the station and the branch track which is in the south side of the station.)

Therefore, the station of the Kintetsu Kyoto Line became independent as Kintetsu-Tanbabashi Station and the connecting line to the Kintetsu Line was removed (traces of mutual operation can be seen in the bicycle parking area at the north side of the station and at the branch track, which is in the south side of the station).

Therefore, the station of the Kintetsu Kyoto Line became independent as Kintetsu-Tanbabashi Station and the connecting line to the Kintetsu Line was removed (traces of mutual operation can be seen in the bicycle parking area at the north side of the station and at the branch track, which is in the south side of the station).

sen.j: 相互直通運転廃止から約10年間は、双方の駅に相手駅の列車の発車案内装置が設置されていた。
sen.e: During about 10 years after stopping mutual operation, both stations had the guide apparatus for each other.
For a period of approximately ten years after the end of mutual operation, both stations retained guide apparatus for each other.
For a period of approximately ten years after the end of mutual operation, both stations retained guide apparatus for each other.

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）6月20日 桃山駅として開業。
sen.e: The station opened on June 20, 1910, named Momoyama Station.
The station opened on June 20, 1910, and was then called Momoyama Station.
June 20, 1910: The station opened, and was then called Momoyama Station.

sen.j: 1913年（大正12年）7月29日 丹波橋駅と改称。
sen.e: It was renamed as Tanbabashi on July 29, 1913.
It was renamed Tanbabashi Station on July 29, 1913.
July 29, 1913: It was renamed Tanbabashi Station.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（現在の阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: The station became one of the Keihanshin Express Railway (now, Hankyu Railway) due to the amalgamation on October 1, 1943.
The station became part of the Keihanshin Express Railway (presently the Hankyu Railway) due to the amalgamation that took place on October 1, 1943.
October 1, 1943: The station became part of the Keihanshin Express Railway (presently the Hankyu Railway) due to the amalgamation that took place.

sen.j: 1945年（昭和20年）12月21日 奈良電気鉄道（現在の近鉄京都線）との共同駅となり、相互乗り入れ開始。
sen.e: As a shared station with Nara Electric Railway (now, Kintetsu Kyoto Line), mutual operation started on December 21, 1945.
Mutual operation started on December 21, 1945 as a shared station with Nara Electric Railway (currently the Kintetsu Kyoto Line).
December 21, 1945: Mutual operation started as a shared station with Nara Electric Railway (currently the Kintetsu Kyoto Line).

sen.j: 1946年（昭和21年）急行電車の運行復活に際し、伏見桃山駅に代わって急行停車駅となる。
sen.e: When the express train service revived in 1946, the station was used for express train stop in place of Fushimi-momoyama Station.
When the express train service was revived in 1946, the station was used for express train stops in place of Fushimi-momoyama Station.
1946: When the express train service was revived, the station was used for express train stops in place of Fushimi-momoyama Station.

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）12月1日 会社分離により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: The station became one of the Keihan Electric Railway due to the separation of companies on December 1, 1949.
The station became part of the Keihan Electric Railway due to the separation of companies that occurred on December 1, 1949.
December 1, 1949: The station became part of the Keihan Electric Railway due to the separation of companies that occurred.

sen.j: 1967年（昭和42年）3月29日 南口の橋上駅舎および近鉄丹波橋駅との連絡通路使用開始。
sen.e: The elevated station-house in the south exit and the walk-through between the south exit and Kintetsu Tanbabashi Station opened on March 29, 1967.
The elevated station house at the south exit and the walk-through between the south exit and Kintetsu-Tanbabashi Station opened on March 29, 1967.
March 29, 1967: The elevated station house at the south exit and the walk-through between the south exit and Kintetsu-Tanbabashi Station opened.

sen.j: 1968年（昭和43年）12月20日 近鉄京都線との相互乗り入れ廃止。
sen.e: The mutual operation with the Kintetsu Kyoto Line was ceased on December 20, 1968.
Mutual operation with the Kintetsu Kyoto Line ceased on December 20, 1968.
December 20, 1968: Mutual operation with the Kintetsu Kyoto Line ceased.

sen.j: 1972年（昭和47年）3月22日 南口駅舎から西側に出る出口を追加。
sen.e: The exit toward west was added in the south exit station-house on March 22, 1972.
The exit toward the west was added at the south exit station house on March 22, 1972.
March 22, 1972: The exit toward the west was added at the south exit station house.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）3月10日 8両連結に対応するために構内踏切を廃止してホーム延長、北口改札を地下化。
sen.e: On March 10, 1987, the railroad crossing in the station yard was abandoned and the platforms were extended for accepting eight-cars train, and also the ticket gate in the north exit was situated underground.

On March 10, 1987, the railroad crossing in the station yard was abandoned, and the platforms were extended for accepting eight-car trains; additionally, the ticket gate in the north exit was moved underground.

March 10, 1987: The railroad crossing in the station yard was abandoned, and the platforms were extended for accepting eight-car trains; additionally, the ticket gate in the north exit was moved underground.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）8月1日 「京阪丹波橋東ビル」オープン。
sen.e: `Keihan Tanbabashi East Building' was opened on August 1, 1988.
The 'Keihan Tanbabashi East Building' opened on August 1, 1988.
August 1, 1988: The 'Keihan Tanbabashi East Building' opened.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）9月9日 「京阪丹波橋西ビル」オープン。
sen.e: `Keihan Tanbabashi West Building' was opened on September 9, 1988.
The 'Keihan Tanbabashi West Building' opened on September 9, 1988.
September 9, 1988: The 'Keihan Tanbabashi West Building' opened.

sen.j: 1991年（平成3年）7月1日 上下線の各ホームに冷房付き待合室使用開始。
sen.e: The waiting room equipped with an air conditioner was set up at each platform on July 1, 1991.
As of July 1, 1991, each platform had a waiting room equipped with an air conditioner.
July 1, 1991: Each platform had a waiting room equipped with an air conditioner.

sen.j: 1995年（平成7年）11月10日 南口に通り抜け型エレベーター2基設置。
sen.e: Two walk-through type elevators were settled in the south exit on November 10, 1995.
The installation of two walk-through type elevators was completed at the south exit on November 10, 1995.
November 10, 1995: The installation of two walk-through type elevators was completed at the south exit.

sen.j: 1996年（平成8年）12月21日 南口橋上駅に身障者対応の多目的トイレ設置。
sen.e: A multipurpose restroom for the physically-challenged was set up in the elevated station-house of the south exit on December 21, 1996.
A multipurpose restroom for the physically challenged was set up in the elevated station house of the south exit on December 21, 1996.
December 21, 1996: A multipurpose restroom for the physically challenged was set up in the elevated station house of the south exit.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）1月19日 駅事務所橋上駅へ移設。
sen.e: The station office was moved in the elevated station-house on January 19, 1997.
The station office was moved to the elevated station house on January 19, 1997.
January 19, 1997: The station office was moved to the elevated station house.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）1月21日 橋上駅舎とホーム間に上下エスカレーター4基設置使用開始。
sen.e: 4 up and down escalators were set up between the elevated station-house and platforms on January 21, 1997.
The installation of four up/down escalators between the elevated station house and the platforms was completed on January 21, 1997.
January 21, 1997: The installation of four up/down escalators between the elevated station house and the platforms was completed.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）3月31日 橋上駅舎とホーム間にエレベーター2基設置。
sen.e: Two elevators were set up to connect the station-house and platforms on March 31, 1997.
The installation of two elevators connecting the station house and platforms was completed on March 31, 1997.
March 31, 1997: The installation of two elevators connecting the station house and platforms was completed.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）9月 橋上駅舎拡張工事竣工。
sen.e: The expansion work of the elevated station-house was completed in September, 1997.
The work for the expansion of the elevated station house was completed in September 1997.
September 1997: The work for the expansion of the elevated station house was completed.

sen.j: 1998年（平成10年）7月15日 駅構内に銀行のATM設置、使用開始。
sen.e: ATM machine was settled in the station yard on July 15, 1998.
An ATM machine was installed in the station yard on July 15, 1998.
July 15, 1998: An ATM machine was installed in the station yard.

sen.j: 2000年（平成12年）7月1日 特急終日停車駅となる。
sen.e: The station became the stop of limited express trains throughout the day on July 1, 2000.
On July 1, 2000 the station became a stop for limited express trains throughout the day.
July 1, 2000: The station became a stop for limited express trains throughout the day.

sen.j: ※その後、近鉄丹波橋駅も特急終日停車駅となった。
sen.e: * After that, Kintetsu-Tanbabashi Station also became the stop of limited express throughout the day.
* Subsequently, Kintetsu-Tanbabashi Station also became a stop for limited express trains throughout the day.
* Subsequently, Kintetsu-Tanbabashi Station also became a stop for limited express trains throughout the day.

sen.j: 2004年（平成16年）6月30日 構内に京都銀行のATM設置。
sen.e: ATM machine of the Bank of Kyoto was settled in the station yard on June 30, 2004.
A Bank of Kyoto ATM machine was installed in the station yard on June 30, 2004.
June 30, 2004: A Bank of Kyoto ATM machine was installed in the station yard.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）7月9日 定期券うりばを廃止。
sen.e: The ticket office for commuter ticket was closed on July 9, 2007.
The ticket office for commuter tickets was closed on July 9, 2007.
July 9, 2007: The ticket office for commuter tickets was closed.
